page.title: 10LANDSCAPE - THE LAKES
page.content: The lakes called Brooklands are old gravel workings which have been flooded to provide a recreational area for a variety of interests. A number of paths provide a walk around these lakes which is an ecologists delight AND nightmare, for along with a variety of wild life and plant life there is also plenty of evidence of mans carelessness in the form of rubbish and general vandalism. At one point effluent enters the lakes from the nearby industrial estate. For anglers the lakes provide plenty of fish and endless hours of interest. Permits are required and competitions are often held. Local sea-cadets have their centre beside the lakes and a section gives them an area for water training.
